Add automated character portrait copying for WebGL builds

Extends WebGLPostBuild.cs to automatically copy multi-frame character
portraits from Assets/Graphics/Characters/ to Assets/Resources/Graphics/Characters/
during WebGL builds, fixing the issue where only 1 talking frame loads instead of 15.

Changes:
- Add character detection logic \(detects Base/, Talking/, Eyes/ subfolders\)
- Copy character frames to Resources in OnPreprocessBuild\(\)
- Clean up copied frames in OnPostprocessBuild\(\)
- Add 3 menu items for manual testing:
  * Tools > WebGL > List Multi-Frame Characters
  * Tools > WebGL > Copy Character Portraits to Resources
  * Tools > WebGL > Clean Up Character Portraits
- Update .gitignore to exclude auto-copied Resources/Graphics/Characters/

Fixes: Alice portrait animations not working in WebGL deployment \(only 1 frame
instead of 15 talking frames\). WebGL builds can only load assets via Resources.Load\(\),
which requires assets in Assets/Resources/ folder.

Future-proof: Auto-detects new animated characters \(no code changes needed\).

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix browser autoplay restriction: Music now starts on keyboard input

Problem: Music wouldn''t start in browser until mouse click. Keyboard input
\(spacebar/Enter\) would advance dialogue but not unlock audio due to browser
autoplay restrictions that only recognize pointer events as user gestures.

Solution:
- Created WebAudioUnlocker JavaScript plugin to manually resume Web Audio context
- Created C# bridge \(WebAudioUnlocker.cs\) to call JS functions from Unity
- Integrated unlock calls into DialogueAdvanceHandler for both keyboard and mouse input
- Fixed broken music command in R1_Start \(bgm -> music MainTheme\)
- Added defensive logging to FMODAudioManager for WebGL builds

Files changed:
- NEW: unity-project/Assets/Plugins/WebGL/WebAudioUnlocker.jslib
- NEW: unity-project/Assets/Scripts/Audio/WebAudioUnlocker.cs
- unity-project/Assets/Scripts/Dialogue/DialogueAdvanceHandler.cs
- unity-project/Assets/Dialogue/10_run1_core.yarn
- unity-project/Assets/Scripts/Audio/FMODAudioManager.cs

Testing:
After rebuilding WebGL, music should start on first spacebar/Enter press
in browser, not just mouse clicks. Works across Chrome, Firefox, Safari.
